itemdesc-katzbalger-*: Short Renaissance arming sword. Signature blade of the Landsknecht
itemdesc-bages-*: A Bronze Age sword. Heavy, though a little shorter than the usual swords
itemdesc-mace-*: A slow melee weapon. Deals monstrous crushing damage at the cost of speed
itemdesc-seax-*: Everyday Saxon knife. In everyday life it is used as a tool or as a weapon
itemdesc-gladius-*: The short sword of the Roman Legionaries
itemdesc-carsword-*: The sword of the Carolingian era or as everyone used to call it - the Viking sword
itemdesc-flamberg-*: A longsword with a “flaming” blade. Inflicts monstrous wounds but is particularly fragile.
itemdesc-gross-*: Kriegsmesser literally means a “war knife”. It is a simpler and cheaper analogue of a longsword. Mainly used by landsknechts
itemdesc-axe-*: A battle axe is great for piercing armor
itemdesc-saber-*: Balanced weapon for delivering fast slashes
itemdesc-armor-head-lamelarar-*: Armor made of lamellas and rawhide, an extremely popular option among nomads from the east. Adapted for archery.
itemdesc-armor-legs-lamelarar-*: Armor made of lamellas and rawhide, an extremely popular option among nomads from the east. Adapted for archery.
itemdesc-armor-body-lamelarar-*: Armor made of lamellas and rawhide, an extremely popular option among nomads from the east. Adapted for archery.
itemdesc-armor-head-lamelar-*: Reinforced version made of expensive materials. More protection at the cost of mobility, including hands.
itemdesc-armor-legs-lamelar-*: Reinforced version made of expensive materials. More protection at the cost of mobility, including hands.
itemdesc-armor-body-lamelar-*: Reinforced version made of expensive materials. More protection at the cost of mobility, including hands.
itemdesc-armor-head-segment-*: The helmet of a Roman legionnaire is extremely utilitarian and incredibly beautiful.
itemdesc-armor-legs-segment-*: Greaves were not popular among legionnaires, but they will obviously be useful to you.
itemdesc-armor-body-segment-*: The Lorica Segmentata is the most famous armor of the Roman legionaries, despite the fact that it was actually very rare. Quite lightweight, practical and protects only the essentials.
itemdesc-shield-scutum-*: The shield of a Roman legionary. The heaviness is compensated by excellent protective properties.
itemdesc-armor-*-samura-*: One of the most famous types of samurai armor. Relatively light and quite durable due to the weaving connecting the scales.
itemdesc-katana-*: A blade without which it is impossible to imagine a Japanese Samurai. Well balanced for fast strikes
itemdesc-pilum-*: The throwing spear of a Roman legionary. The design of the pilum is needed to break through the armor and get stuck in the target. As a result, it is poorly suited for close combat and quickly becomes unusable
itemdesc-spear-*: The most common weapon in the history of mankind. With skillful use, it allows you to keep a distance from the enemy. You can still throw it, but it won't fly far
item-shield-scutum-red: Iconic, durable Roman shield. Provides near complete protection against aimed and stray enemy blows, through sheer size overlap. Called Scutum and paired with gladius.
item-shield-scutum-green: Iconic, durable Roman shield. Provides near complete protection against aimed and stray enemy blows, through sheer size overlap. Called Scutum and paired with gladius.
item-seax-boneiron: Iron seax with a bone handle
item-seax-meteoricironl: Meteoriciron seax with a leather handle
item-seax-steell: Steel seax with a leather handle
item-seax-steelb: Steel seax with a bone handle
